1.title: Bubble Sort
1.content: Write a program that performs bubble sort on a comma-separated list of numbers. Then print out the sorted list, along with the number of passes needed to sort it (including the pass needed to verify that it is sorted).

solution.code:
# this function performs a single pass of bubble sort
def bubble_pass(arr):
    is_sorted = True
    for i in range(len(arr) - 1):
        if arr[i] > arr[i + 1]:
            arr[i], arr[i + 1] = arr[i + 1], arr[i]
            is_sorted = False
    return arr, is_sorted

# this function performs bubble sort
def bubble_sort(arr):
    passes = 0
    is_sorted = False
    while(not is_sorted):
        arr, is_sorted = bubble_pass(arr)
        passes += 1
    
    # print answer
    print(','.join(str(num) for num in arr))
    print(passes)

# getting and formatting user input
unsorted_list = input()
unsorted_list = [int(num) for num in unsorted_list.split(',')]

# sort and print answer
bubble_sort(unsorted_list)
